thread.title: Youse Guia Joins DoubleLine Capital LP as Chief Compliance Officer

author: cnbc.com
title: Youse Guia Joins DoubleLine Capital LP as Chief Compliance Officer
text:
LOS ANGELES, March 15, 2018 /PRNewswire/ -- Youse Guia, previously deputy chief compliance officer of Pacific Investment Management Company (PIMCO), has joined DoubleLine Capital LP as chief compliance officer of the firm and of the DoubleLine Funds Trust.
"I'm pleased to welcome Youse Guia to our firm," said Jeffrey Gundlach, CEO and chief investment officer of DoubleLine Capital and its affiliated companies. "Youse's depth of management expertise and experience perfectly complement the ongoing diversification of DoubleLine's business into multiple investment strategies and the extension of those product lines into a variety of distribution channels to serve our valued clients in the United States and globally."
Before joining DoubleLine, Mr. Guia served as an executive vice president and deputy chief compliance officer at PIMCO, a Newport Beach, CA-headquartered asset manager. He also was chief compliance officer for the PIMCO Sponsored Closed End Funds and Managed Accounts Trust. Prior to joining PIMCO in 2014, Mr. Guia was the head of U.S. compliance for Allianz Global Investors and the chief compliance officer for the Allianz Funds from September 2004 through February 2014.
Mr. Guia previously worked six years as an audit manager with PricewaterhouseCoopers, specializing in the investment management industry. He earned his BS in business administration with a major in accounting, from the California State Polytechnic University, Pomona.
Mr. Guia succeeds Adam Rossetti as chief compliance officer of DoubleLine Capital. Mr. Rossetti continues at DoubleLine as an attorney in the firm's legal department.
About DoubleLine Capital LP
DoubleLine Capital LP is a registered investment adviser under the Investment Advisers Act of 1940. DoubleLine Capital and its related companies ("DoubleLine") managed $118 billion in assets across all vehicles, including open-end mutual fund, closed-end fund, exchange-traded fund, hedge fund, variable annuity, UCITS, collective investment trust and separate account, according to preliminary estimates of the December 31 end of the fourth quarter of 2017. DoubleLine's offices can be reached by telephone at (213) 633-8200 or by e-mail at info@doubleline.com . Media can e-mail DoubleLine at media@doubleline.com .
